reasoning.technical_compatibility: Mufflers are specific to ICE vehicles and do not have a direct counterpart in EVs.
reasoning.manufacturing_feasibility: Existing manufacturing equipment may be repurposed for some parts of muffler production, but significant modifications would likely be required.
reasoning.supply_chain_concentration: The supply chain for mufflers is highly concentrated due to the limited number of specialized manufacturers.
reasoning.demand_stability: Demand for mufflers is expected to decline as EV adoption increases and ICE phase-out regulations are enforced.
reasoning.value_added: Muffler production involves a moderate level of skill, complexity, and economic value, but it is not at the same level as many high-tech EV components.
reasoning.regulatory_exposure: Mufflers are exposed to significant regulatory risk due to their close association with ICE vehicles, which are at the center of ICE phase-out regulations.

reasoning.technical_compatibility: Catalytic converters are ICE-specific and do not play a role in EVs.
reasoning.manufacturing_feasibility: Though some parts may be usable, major modifications would likely be needed to repurpose existing manufacturing equipment for EV components.
reasoning.supply_chain_concentration: The catalytic converter market has several key players, but this concentration could increase as demand for ICE vehicles declines.
reasoning.demand_stability: Demand for catalytic converters will likely collapse with the phase-out of ICE vehicles.
reasoning.value_added: The manufacturing process for catalytic converters has moderate complexity and economic value, but it is not as high as some EV components.
reasoning.regulatory_exposure: Catalytic converters are strongly affected by the phase-out of ICE vehicles due to their exclusive use in internal combustion engines.

reasoning.technical_compatibility: The exhaust manifold is ICE-specific and has no technical role in EVs.
reasoning.manufacturing_feasibility: Existing manufacturing equipment might be repurposed for EV components, but the exhaust manifold is not among them.
reasoning.supply_chain_concentration: The supply chain for exhaust manifolds tends to have few specialized suppliers.
reasoning.demand_stability: Demand for exhaust manifolds will collapse with the rise of EVs and ICE phase-out.
reasoning.value_added: Exhaust manifold production requires relatively low skill, complexity, and economic value compared to other vehicle components.
reasoning.regulatory_exposure: ICE phase-out regulations will significantly reduce demand for exhaust manifolds.

reasoning.technical_compatibility: Tailpipe is specific to ICE vehicles as EVs do not emit exhaust gases.
reasoning.manufacturing_feasibility: Existing manufacturing equipment may be repurposed for some parts, but tailpipes are unique to ICE vehicles and would require new technology.
reasoning.supply_chain_concentration: The supply chain is concentrated as there are few specialized companies producing tailpipes for the automotive industry.
reasoning.demand_stability: Demand for tailpipes will significantly decrease due to the phase-out of ICE vehicles.
reasoning.value_added: Tailpipes have low skill, complexity, and economic value compared to other components in vehicle production.
reasoning.regulatory_exposure: Strict regulations aiming to reduce emissions from ICE vehicles make tailpipe manufacturers highly exposed to phase-out.
